Reviews.Title: “nice pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: trish6Galway
Reviews.Content: just back from a three night break with friend and we stayed at the waldorf. It was a nice clean basic hotel. Hotel rooms nicely furnished, good sized clean bathrooms. All rooms have tea/coffee making facilities, deposit box, mini bar etc. Good breakfast, loads of choice. 5 mins to local metro and 15 mins into the city. Restaurants and some small shops within 500 yards of hotel. Rooms not sound proof so alot of noise from hallways at night. In general a good basic clean, modern hotel. Not great for tourist info or maps.

Reviews.Title: “rome in february”
Reviews.Author: rafaell0
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five days. I really enjoyed. I found everything in good condition. The breakfast was very good and tasty - especially coffee. there was good selection of bread, sweets and meat. The hotel is not in the city centre but is well conected with the centre by metro line A. just five minutes walk from the hotel to the metro station Cornelia. Five minutes walk is also to the bus station, which is great conected with the Fiumicino Airport. The room was quite big and clean, warm enough and the bed was confortable. Ihe price for that room was reasonable. I just had a bad experience at the reception. I think staff was not polite enough. After all, staying at this hotel I think is a good and happy to go back there. I recommend the hotel to all visitors to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “B&H Hotels Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: BeckyK893
Reviews.Content: We booked a group of 12 at The Waldorf B&H and we all found it to be very nice, modern, clean, friendly and efficient. The breakfast was great, there is a bar onsite, and there was a decent and reasonable restaurant around the corner. We had transportation to and from the hotel, so we can’t say for sure how close the metro is but we understand it is close by. For anyone considering this hotel, it is a good value. Don & Becky

Reviews.Title: “Great value and clean”
Reviews.Author: Louise K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2011 and loved every minute of it. The hotel is slightly out of the centre of Rome but as it was the peak of the summer we hired a scooter and this actually made our weekend. We stayed for 3 nights and paid about £140 which included breakfast and the hotel was great value for money. We had secure parking for the scooter round the back of the hotel and the hotel staff couldn't do enough for us. Our room was on the top floor and was fantastic, the bathroom was small but thats to be expected in a European city. We had a huge balcony which was lovely to sit on as it was so warm. The room was clean and the breakfast had a bit of everything. If you dont mind staying 10 minutes from the centre and want value for money then i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, very unfriendly, location 3 train stops west of Vatican, not like they say in promotions.”
Reviews.Author: nate h
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind hiking out of the city center on the metro to get to your hotel, or if you are driving a car, than this hotel will work for you. If you are on foot/using local transporation, it is a bit of a hike. Metro ride to train station Termini is good 30 minutes. If you are coming from the airport and going to the hotel, you should plan on over an hour getting there, the Leonardo express if a good 40 minutes into Termini, then the metro over to the hotel is another good 20-30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Stayment in Rome”
Reviews.Author: latinopablo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very clean and comfortable, the service is very good, it includes breakfast and is pretty decent, the only thing is that is not very close to downtown, you need to take subway is not far away, but it takes like 20 minutes to the "Vatican" or 25 minutes to "fontana di Trevi" is you have time and you are use to subway it really worth. The hotel is located 5 minutes away from "CORNELIA" station. Compared to other hotels in Italy, this is a very American style hotel, they speak very well English and Spanish. The price is decent. If you like my comment rate it pls, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: muthu_mohon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Waldorf Roma for 2 nights in June 2011. The room was very small with hardly any space to move around but were comfortable with all modern ameneties. Bathrooms were clean, Service was prompt and good. The location is decent with the bus terminus and a metro station within walking distance. Would recommend taking the breakfast option - the buffet was very good and if you intend to spend the day roaming around the city - what better than to tuck into a hearty breakfast. Internet connection is available in the lobby for free use of the the hotel's guests but problem is there is only one so youmay have to wait a while.

Reviews.Title: “Small but fairly clean...”
Reviews.Author: Cathyccc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week. Since a quad room was not available we had to take two rooms which were reasonably priced. The rooms were very small, but the sheets, towels, and bathroom were clean. The air conditioning worked like a dream thank goodness as it was very hot. The breakfast in the mornings was nice and the dining area was bright and the service was pleasant. The desk help should take some pointers from the dining servers as they weren't as helpful or nice. The subway was only a short walk from the hotel which made getting around the city very easy. There were also some great little out of the way restaurants close by which in comparison to the fare in downtown Rome, were much cheaper and our kids loved them. Like I said, the rooms were very small, but overall, if you are on a budget, it's a decent spot to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean but so tiny”
Reviews.Author: TravelbuffMontreal
Reviews.Content: Although the staff tries their best to please all guests, the room size is to be desired! This is a tiny hotel, recently renovated, the bathrooms are very clean and the beds are very comfortable. The prices should revised, an extra bed costs 30 euros which becomes very pricey. A room at this hotel should not be more than 100$ euors. Breakfast was very nice and breakfast area very clean. However the reception area should be renovated as it is not very welcoming. Not close to city center, you must take a cab or the metro. Not convenient for senoirs.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the city center”
Reviews.Author: VanValGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little ways from the city center but it was a quiet neighborhood and priced accordingly. And just a few blocks from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the Center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Beattie01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far from the city center in a grafitti riddled area. The metro is a couple of blocks away but Sunday through Friday it does not go this far after 9pm and the bus was hard to navigate. The staff was not that friendly at the desk when we were there. The room was not that clean and the hotel shower could have been easier to open. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but it does not open until 0730 am which can make it difficult if you have an early flight. It was a place to sleep, but nothing special in a run down part of the city away from the fun and attractions. They do not allow you in your room until 2:00pm which makes it difficult after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LucyMorrell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent hotel, the staff are all really friendly and the room was very clean. My partner and I really enjoyed the fantastic breakfast. The hotel is situated very close to the metro which gives excellent links to all of Rome. We would recommend this hotel every time!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good breakfast, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: AndrewDaniSally5164
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a weekend in September 2011, we booked a double room, when we arrived we found out that was 2 single beds pushed together, as we were only sleeping there no problem. My wife then found hair in the basins, after the room had been cleaned. we then found a used condom packet on the side of the bed not really acceptable. staff were very friendly and helpful Breakfast was good and there was lots of it We wont ever stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Fairly satisfied !!”
Reviews.Author: katerina v
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good for the class and the money that you pay. The stuff is even better!! They are very friendly smilly helpful... 5star staff! Breakfast is very good also.... Rooms are ok if you satisfy yourself to stay in the room just to sleep and bathe, because they are small but very clean! There was every day tea kettle so it was very relaxing after so much walking and so cold a hot tea in the room... It is a very good choice for couples or for those who want peace. I don't recommend it for families with small children because there are not facilities for kids. About the location... the metro station is very close to the hotel so if you don't mind to use the metro you will not have problem! But if you want to walk around you will not find anything interesting in this area except a pizzeria on the corner that i dont remember the name (it was with yellow letters) but i recommend to go there if you want to eat somewhere near... I work in 5stars hotels and i think this hotel is very good for its class!

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING TO REGRET, BUT JUST GOOD MEMORIES”
Reviews.Author: Maurizio1588
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the room was perfect. Very good breakfast with large variety and very helpful staff. definitely will use again we will be back in rome.

Reviews.Title: “NIce place to stay if you just need a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: BRibeiro
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. The lobby was very nice the staff was pleasant. We arrived to early to check in so they allowed up to store our bags in their luggage room so we could start sight seeing. The hotel was a 5-8 min walk from the subway station. The room was nice but very small. It would be nice for one person but for 2 it was kinda cramped. The bathroom. was just as cramped. The 2 of us could not be in there at the same time. While I was taking a shower the shower door fell off on me. Luckily my husband fixed it. No free wifi you had to pay 3 euro's an hour which seemed very steep to me so we didnt use it. Free breakfast was included and it was wonderful. Such a huge selection of food. Very pleased with this hotel bedsides the shower door almost killing me. lol

Reviews.Title: “bad location, bad service, bad room, bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBugy
Reviews.Content: Location is far from everything. Nothing nearby. Closest attraction is Vatican, which is 4-5 metro stops away. Long walk (not an easy walk too) from nearest metro if you have luggage. Dirty carpet, old room, running toilet. Internet is expensive (3euro/hr) & not accessible from the rooms. My single bed was a cheap cot bed/roll away bed in an extremely small room. Small room is fine but the hostel bed is not acceptable in a hotel. My sleep was lousy because of the mini-sized "twin" bed & I kept hitting the wall because the bed is right against the wall. Service is minimal. They tried to put a smile on the face but you can tell they are not sincere because they don't look at you when talking to you & answers are always short. You can tell they just want you to go away. Price is not cheap too. $90 euros/night. $10 euros more you can find an equivalent or better room right in the center. The morning front desk staff is the only one on a Sat morning (busy check-in/out time), which shows problems in this hotel's management. I asked to have a "real" bed or refund me for 2nd night the staff refused. I booked through Hotels.com, who did not do a good job to help me either (supervisor answered didn't know a thing about negotiation 101) & just let me deal w/it myself. One guest overheard the conversation between hotel staff & Hotels.com told me the staff told Hotels.com that he can fix the problem but I was not polite so he has nothing for me. He told me there no double room to upgrade me, which he lied. My friend called to ask for a double room for the night & was told there are availabilities. The website advertised "queen bed or twin bed" but when I showed the staff he said it's false (really??). Also, the "single room/twin bed" picture was not on the website. Major false advertisement. The pictures on the website are very misleading & the 5* reviews better not be written by the hotel staff themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ribarnika
Reviews.Content: The waldorf hotel is walking distance of about 2km from center of Rome. Transport connections are very good, underground train Cornelia is only 5 minutes walk. The hotel is good, breakfast is super, rooms are ok. As i said good value for money ,when in Rome. Ribarnika

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: SandiCrack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my Sister, Neice and Mum (age range 20 - 66). We all thought it was a good hotel - clean room, clean towels, friendly staff - especially the restaurant chap Marco. I would definetly recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel - clean, good service for the price”
Reviews.Author: Benkei
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and tidy and staff very accommodating. Near to subway but beware - the line closes at 9 every night except Saturday while a new metro line is being built (May 2012). Buses run instead but not always easy to find! The room was small but we spent little time in it so it was fine. Bathroom was clean and tidy and one minor problem was resolved within a couple of minutes of us reporting it. I WAS glad I brought earplugs - you can hear the people in the rooms around (just general noise rather than any particular rowdiness) though traffic noise was not too bad. The breakfast was excellent - probably the best choice I have had for a continental style breakfast on these kind of trips in Europe. If you want value for money and to spend your hard earned cash on travelling and seeing things rather than on a luxury room to sleep in then this is for you. If you need enough room to swing a cat or are bothered by hearing other people then earplugs are a must but with them I was more than happy with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: stephmmses
Reviews.Content: Room was small but clean and comfortable. Bring a hair dryer with you. Breakfast is included. Elevator was very small. Very close to a metro station and buses. Great for traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “No free night life”
Reviews.Author: Luiz_Sobrinho
Reviews.Content: During our stay in Rome, we found the hotel close enough to the Subway station of Cornelia, for the daily sightseeing. the subway closes at 09PM except on Saturday until May 2012 !!! So, if you count on Subway to move, forget, the buses covers for the same fee, but usually crowded. I would suggest to look for somewhere close to Piazza de Spagna... Other considerations... There is NO internet on the rooms. ONLY in the reception by buying a card at reception, which, was over one day...and I was not able to use it... We were three couples of friends travelling... so, I can say that i we were each one, put in a completely different room...for the same money. Issues like, no space on the room nor on the bathroom, or no space on the room but a bathtub to compensate, or average space on the room and on the bathroom, but very old carpet... and none of us got the requested twin bed, they gave us two single beds instead... for the price paid, it's was ok, but I missed some proximity to the Rome night life.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: 45Jen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for what we needed, near to the Metro, the room was a bit small but was very clean with nice hot shower and a safe in the wardrobe. The breakfast was good with lots of choice of food with lovely coffee and fresh rolls. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “PICTURES LOOK NOTHING LIKE HOTEL ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: Jenn023
Reviews.Content: We were excited about our stay at this hotel but the rooms were NOTHING like pictured on their webiste. The bathroom was the worst part - moldy dirty shower. The sliding door was broken, so the sliding panel was replaced with an oversized, ripped, mouldy shower curtain. The decor it shows in the picture was not representative of the room we got. My final complaint were the piles of cigaretter butts that lined the balconey. Not impressed by this hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast and worth for money.”
Reviews.Author: FrancesMalta
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week, we were very satisfied with the room. Small but clean room, friendly staff and near the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: blueraven1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Partner.He booked a trip to Rome for my Birthday.I was pregnant at the time,so we chose a hotel that had a ground floor room available and was near to the Metro/underground.The Hotel was situated in a residential area and about 5 mins walk from the Metro station which takes you all around Rome,so was very handy.The area was a bit dimly lit at night but I felt safe.At the top of the street,was a lovely little traditional restaurant called Frankies. We had a lovely meal here on one of the nights and it was a two min walk back to the hotel. On checking i.the staff were very pleasant and helpful.They gave us a map of the city and pointed out all the major attractions.They then advised us on how to get to them(which is very easy due to the great underground travel network).Our room (on the ground floor)was a bit small but it was modern,very clean and had a nice bathroom and well-stocked mini-fridge.It had double doors,which opened out onto a little garden...I would advise booking a room on the ground floor though as they seem more modern than the "shabbier" rooms that we seen upstairs. The breakfast buffet was great with pastries,cereal,fruit and hot food,te&coffee.It really set us up for the day(which is essential in Rome as you do lots of walking)!!!Staff were all lovely and very helpful. All in all,a great hotelin a handy location....and we got a good dealon the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Not in a "Safe Location", as guaranteed by staff”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMermaid
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily because we needed the guarantee that our vehicle would be safe at this Hotel during our stay in Rome. It was not. We arrived in Rome, mid Sunday afternoon and parked DIRECTLY outside the hotel. The residential area appeared to be very quiet. Whilst we checked in most of our luggage, we left a few things behind in the boot of the car, which were totally concealed. We raced off for a quick 4 hour sightseeing trip and by 7pm that evening, had found the car windows smashed and everything taken. Strangely, no one saw or heard anything. Not very safe at all. Apart from that, the reception service was a little slow and they didnt seem to be able to handle the other complaints from patrons. The Wi-Fi they promised, didnt function and the carpet in our room was falling apart under our feet due to the leaking airconditioning system; not to mention the stench of wet decaying carpet. We paid €97,00 per night and dont believe we got value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Gtreat Hotel For The Price Near Metro and Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Bargain_Benno
Reviews.Content: Positives: Walking distance to Metro. Excellent Buffett Breakfast. Only a short bus ride to Vatican. Quiet street. Adequate Rooms. Good Value For Money Negatives. Walls are paper thin, has problems with people leaving hot water running, management overbook and try to offload you at "sister" hotels, a rather dirty area of Rome, Far too much noise of a personal nature from other rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Substandard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calabs12
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a perfect location for Metro to centre of Rome but the hotel itself is very substandard. Our double room was very small ( nothing like the photo's on their website ) with only one single wardrobe and 4 coat hangers for all our clothes and no drawers either. The breakfast was mostly cold plate and what passed for bacon and eggs was always cold also, not the sort of start you need for the long trek around Rome.B&H get your act together and update this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable base for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte1209
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to those seeking a comfortable base for seeing Rome. We stayed for 4 nights in a triple room (Mum and 2 teenagers). The room was spacious, with English TV and a balcony overlooking a quiet residential street. It appeared to have been recently refurbished, with a very nice bathroom and air conditioning. Fresh towels every day and toiletries were provided. The hotel is situated close (3-4 mins walk) to the Cornelia metro station, which takes you into central rome within 10 minutes. We took a train and metro from Fiumicino airport to save on taxi fares. This was fine, but if you would struggle carrying cases up stairs, a taxi may be easier. Be sure to take the Via Boccea PARI exit from the metro station (there are several exits!). There are well-priced, authentic restaurants between the metro station and hotel. There was an extensive breakfast at the hotel - you would have to be extremely picky not to find anything you wanted to eat! Service was always friendly and helpful. There was a bar and roof terrace, but we were out til late every day so didn't use them. In summary, I don't understand how this hotel received poor reviews before (perhaps they were written prior to a refurbishment or new management?). It exceeded our expectations for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: silly_old_amy
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews for the hotel B&H Waldorf on here before travelling to Rome I was slightly concerned about the distance of the hotel to the centre of Rome. However, I need not have worried! Sure, it's not in the centre of the action, but who wants to be right in the thick of it all with noisy traffic and tiny rooms for extortionate prices? The hotel is very near a metro stop, and it only takes 15 minutes or so to get into the centre of Rome. A pleasure when you are used to hour long commutes in London! Using the Metro is only 1 euro per trip, so you are hardly spending a fortune getting in and out. We also used the bus on one occassion to get into Rome and this was quick and painless. The hotel is clean and tidy and the rooms large. My only concern would be that we were placed on the ground floor so did not have the best view (of the service area outside) but there was a nice garden seating area nearby so this was not a worry. The air conditioning was great and kept us cool all night. Breakfast had a good selection, not the worlds best quality food but enough to set you up for the day, plenty of pastries, bread and cakes and some hot food too in the way of eggs and bacon. Surprisingly lovely coffee from the coffee machines. Staff were knowledgeable and helpful. We asked for directions to the catacombs and the reception fellow was happy to help. We were going to use the internet in the hotel but at three euro for an hour we found this too much. The receptionist told us to go around the corner where there was an internet cafe where we went online for one euro an hour. Great service! All in all a great base for exploring Rome at a good value price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Helpful Staff, comfortable rooms, nice rooftop area”
Reviews.Author: westie98
Reviews.Content: This trip was a city break for me and my fella .Great Bed and Breakfast, lovely choice of breakfast and drinks and also staff always very friendly. Reception staff were also very helpful in assisting us with our tourist questions .....where is the nearest tube station etc. Location of the Waldorf is on a residential street the underground subway is literally 5 mins away and the metro is only 1 Euro which is a bargain as 5 stops away is The Vatican and all of the sights I would say it is a comfortable 3 star and did the job which was somewhere to rest my head as I had no intention of being in the room!! Lovely terrace garden to chill on the summer nights and on the roof there are some patio chairs and loungers.....nice and quiet up there! I don't know why other reviewers complained but we had a great time and got engaged!! Would go back to the Waldorf B&H again!!

Reviews.Title: “Walked in, then walked out!”
Reviews.Author: LaScalaUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 20 minutes by metro from Roma Termini station. It's quite easy to find from the metro station but the neighbourhood is not the best. The hotel itself has very friendly staff, some of whom who can manage to speak English: most just speak Italian. The rooms reminded me of a football camp stay I had in a northern seaside town in England called Morecambe (or Blackpool). The fittings were very cheap and worn out. The televisions were outdated and the volume did not work. There was signs that damp had been removed from the bathroom and the bed mattresses were bare - you could feel the springs coming through. Two single beds pushed together seems to be the way in Italy, which was fine. Also for the rate, they provided free dressing gown and slippers. I would have preferred to have free wi-fi (not 5 euro an hour!) and a cheaper room rate...140 euro was a bit steep. In the UK, I would pay £40 / night maximum. The walls were also very thin and before we checked out of our 30 minute stay we could hear the family next door shouting at each other. In the end myself and my partner decided we could not stay and booked another hotel which was much better, more central and a completely different standard. I asked if there were any better rooms than the 'Superior Double' I booked, and I was told there were no other rooms available. Plus points: - Staff friendly and helpful; Negatives: - Hotel condition; - Hotel furnishings; - Hotel nowhere near a 3*. I would say 1* or 2*. - Hotel reviews for this hotel on tripadvisor are not representative of the hotel condition as a whole. We expected a lot more. Sorry Waldorf, we felt let down.

Reviews.Title: “Room was very small”
Reviews.Author: Malta231
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights. The room was very small. On the back of the door there was a certificate (note) indicating that the room was for two persons but they put in another two beds. When I asked the receptionist about this he told me that it was a room for 4 persons and that all rooms had the same certificate on the back of the door!! I couldn't even find the power outlets since they were hidden behind the pillows - since the two extra beds replaced the bedside tables. The partitions separating the rooms are very thin and I could hear people in other rooms having a shower and talking in the middle of the night. I was not impressed with the breakfast. Expected better after reading most of the reviews. The only two positive things were a) cleanliness b) good location near the metro station .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmasid
Reviews.Content: It's a nice place to spend your vacations in Rome, the best is it quite close to a Metro and Bus Station. So you can move through Rome easily. Bed Rooms are quite smalls, but in my opinion that is enough for the use you are giving, the best of Rome is out of the Hotel!!! This hotel has clean baths, and the breakfast is not the best I imagine, mainly, being in Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Lobren
Reviews.Content: Initally I was a bit worried having read some of the reviews on tripadvisor and because I got such a good rate for this Hotel but I did not need to be. The Hotel is located outside the city centre 3 mins walk from Cornelia metro stop on the red line. Initally the location looks a little unclean - graphity etc however we were there from 5 days and never had any issues, in fact people were very helpful especially on the metro. The Hotel staff were very accomodating, helpful and friendly. They organised a taxi to and from the airport for us without any hassle. Rooms are clean and well presented. All amenties are available - hairdryer, minibar (which is very cheap!), towels, grooming products and anything which you may have forgotten can be provided for in reception. Breakfast is very good, even as a vegetarian I was spoiled for choice. Internet access is available in the lobby and there is a small bar also for drinks and snacks. The only downside to the hotel were the French style beds - two single beds joined together which I found a little uncomfortable. On a whole I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great breadfast, good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: SuperRaptor
Reviews.Content: it locates in a residential area, it is not that close to rome centre but it is about 5 mins walk to Metro so it is not a big deal. the staff was very helpful. the room is in a reasonable size with a small balcony and pretty quiet. the bathroom is pretty large for a 3* hotel. the breadfast was very good with lots of choices. the only thing is that it doesnt provide adapter but beside that, this hotel is not a bad choice!

Reviews.Title: “No value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Nonksjra
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Very small room, no hot water, very noisy and the worst breakfast i have ever seen. Maybe i'm spoiled, but a breakfast needs to have at least some sort of bread. One star is more than enough for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: candiceabeth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Waldorf Hotel and I have to say I'm really impressed! I had read the couple of negetive reviews so was slightly worried but shouldn't have been. We booked a last minute deal through lastminute.com so got this quite cheap - the room we were given was small but fine for sleeping & showering which is all you want to do on a city break! (There are bigger rooms available as I saw then being cleaned!!) The room was immaculately clean and the maid service was excellent with clean towels daily. All the staff were polite and friendly. The breakfast was amazing for a hotel like this - I wouldn't call it American, more european (with a stab at bacon, eggs and beans!) but plenty to eat in the morning. The only downsides for this hotel is it's initial location - it says it's 100m from the metro - but it didn't say which exit to get out of (there are 3) so we ended up walking for ages trying to find it. When we did finally get the right exit it is literally a 2 minute walk. I would suggest taking a routemap with you out of the metro and to the Hotel which we forgot to do. You need exit 'Boccea via Pari'. The metro was amazing though - and whilst the hotel is quite far out, I think it probably is easier to get to the main sites than some of the more central hotels that aren't on a metro line. It takes about 12 minutes to get to the Cornelia metro from Termini station which is amazing considering it is quite far out. Also the walls are quite thin. Also don't be put off by the area the hotel is in - itilially it looks quite run down until you realise the whole of Rome is covered in graffiti!! The first night we ate locally at a restaurant just on the corner of the street you turn into for the hotel - it was amazing and highly recommended. The pizza's were great. The Waldorf was an excellent hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommythegardener
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Waldorf and were very pleased with accomadations. The breakfast was very good.We were surprised to find that it was an English Breakfast. The rooms were very clean and modern. There is both a secret garden and a rooftop garden for the use of the guests. The hotel is located near the subway and is a short trip to all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A DECENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: clyde15
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from rome and we had a great time staying at the waldorf....though initially we were put in a tiny room we complained and were moved the next day to a larger room that was clean..had a good sized bathroom that was clean and well equipped and from then on had no problems with this hotel at all...the staff were friendly and helpful...at first we thought the local area was a bit rough but after getting to know the place it was fine with a couple of lovley restaurants locally...the tube is just 2mins from the hotel and theres a bus station nearby too...we used the tube every day and found it fast and efficient....i read a few less than complimentary reviews about this hotel before going but i must admit that it was a good place to stay apart from the tiny room at the start incident id give it a strong 8/10...the restaurant (osteradiaviatardini) right next to the entrance of cornelia metro station is a place not to miss...the food is really excellent and also check out frankies at the top of the road from the hotel for excellent pizzas....theres a couple of nice cafes nearby too with cappucinos at 90cents compared to 5euro at piazza navona....all in all i would reccomend this place and would also like to say that having re-read a few of the poorer reviews this hotel has recieved i think its a bit unfair of the critics to say the things they have..they are perhaps being a tad picky though this did concern me before i went i now know that the place is ok...enjoy your holiday..rome is a beautiful city....take comfortable shoes as your gonna be doing a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good value.”
Reviews.Author: OptiBill2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in September with another couple. Our room was very small but very clean and looked recently redecorated. Bathroom was shiny and clean with new tiles on floor and walls and great tub/shower. Check-in was speedy. Front desk always helpful except for late night staff. Wireless internet non-existent in room, worked in lobby but 5 Euros per hour. Used a neighbouring router for free. Breakfast was a good way to start the day. Not great but included in the price. Lots of food, good staff and nice room. Housekeeping every day. Only a 5 minute walk to subway, 15 minutes downtown. Several nice little restaurants in area for pizza and pasta. In residential neighbourhood so quiet. Commercial area is working class but we felt safe. No real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Stop Moaning great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AndypandyHampshire
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now and I must say I cannot see why people moan. Our room both times has been nice, clean and a good size with airconditioning etc. Very clean rooms. The staff are really worked hard but are keen to help. Breakfast is fine and lots to chose from. Its a 5 min walk from the metro underground which gets you to the spanish steps in 5 stops and costs 1 euro for 75 mins travel so really cheap. We hire a motorino and this is great for getting about and you can park this anywhere in the city. Rome is expensive for hotels so this one is such good value for money. What would you get in London for the same money?

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve the bad reputation.”
Reviews.Author: Jamsie_853
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews on here, I approached my holiday with some hesitation. I needn't worry however, the hotel is located in a quiet neighbourhood with excellent local amenities, excellent after a busy day of sight-seeing in more mainstream areas with some excellent resturants and bars. Staff were incredibly friendly, and were able to answer any queries we had and recommended restaurants and places of interest. The rooms were of impeccable standard, and everything neatly presented and the view from the balcony was excellent. The secret garden and terrace were welcome treasures, and relaxing with a few drinks after a long, hot day was an aspect to look forward to. Cornelia station is easily close by, and takes five minutes by foot. Trains are air-conditioned and come every two to three minutes, and you are in Spagna by ten minutes. Breakfast was lovely, an excellent array of hot and cold food ranging from pastries and a selection of hot and cold drinks. Overall, an excellent week, with great company and lovely customer service. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Freddt
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are very small, booked a double room but the room I was given was very small about 8 X 10 ft. There were two single beds which is not ideal as a couple, the bathroom was very small also . I asked kindly for a room change and the reception were very rude, I got there at 2.00pm to check in but he informed me all the other rooms were booked in a very angry tone, although I could see other rooms available on his books. My friends got a better room than us with two beds joined and a room size of 12 X 12, the bathroom was much larger and nicer, the toilet did not flush properly and the AC was very noisy. They did not bother to complain as they were happy with the room size and did not want to get a room like ours. We bought a bottle of champagne and left it open in our room on the first night, on returning from our day trip out on the second day, our room was nice and clean with our bottle missing. I would never book at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone. Find an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Interesting Location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrails71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Hotel Waldorf for a 3 night stay despite some concerns stemming from reviews on this website. The deal was too good to pass and it had been reccomended. In the end, I was more than happy with my experience because the Waldorf happens to be a great value. The service is reasonably good, the rooms and public spaces are clean, and the location provides easy access to all of Rome's brilliant attractions via the Cornelia Metro. The neighborhood was safe, filled with shops and restaurants, and it was actually quite interesting to watch the average Roman go about his daily business in what seemed a typical neighborhood. I don't really think you can go wrong with this property unless you have outlandish expectations. It is a budget hotel but certainly delivers in terms quality/price ratio...I have to wonder if many of the bad reviews were not written by people with relatively little experience traveling in Rome, where standards in terms of room size are below those of other cities. As for me, I now know the Waldorf is a reliable option any time I return to the beautiful Eternal City!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: MariaYotova
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not very far from the city center, but you should get the metro. The rooms are too small, the bathrooms too. No space for nothing inside. The Reception administrators were extremely rude and impolite, asking me "Seniora, do you understand English? We cannot change your room, you will stay there." .. as we were supposed to and we are obliged to feel like in a box. The breakfast, though, was very rich and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: etnfrd67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! Rooms are the the normal size for a European hotel if not a little bigger. Very clean and great service very friendly and helpful. Had no problem staying here for a week. The free breakfast is great just enough to fill you up before going site seeing. Close to buses and metro (4 min walk).

Reviews.Title: “horrible venue donot book !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maryco
Reviews.Content: The hotel should be sued for giving false information about the hotel and the size of rooms. The bathroom is so so small and cold with no windows or ventilation. The carpet is dirty. You would not stand bare foot. In the shower I wore my flip flops.The room is so small to passthe other person in the room you have to stand beside the wall. You can here every noise in the hotel from 4am.Breakfast consists of stale breads, tinned fruit, scrambled eggs you just could not describe let alon eat. Tea that tasts of whatever has come out of the machine prior to your drink. I could write for hours but take my advise look else where.

Reviews.Title: “Not great...”
Reviews.Author: echo10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at this hotel in September. To be honest, if we had booked anymore than 2 nights we would have checked out. The room was so tiny you couldn't get a suitcase through the door past the furniture so there were large chunks of plaster missing off the wall. The air conditioning didn't work sufficiently and the rooms were not overly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: RococcoRoad
Reviews.Content: This is a great value hotel - in an excellent location. I travelled for a 4 day break - and was a bit concerned about having to travel on the metro - as have done it before and it can get very crowded. But not a problem - and the bonus of the hotel being very close to both the metro station and the bus terminal. The hotel itself was very clean and our room was very spacious. Toileteries provided - and proper bath towels - this will strike a chord to those of you reading this who have stayed in low price Italian hotels before!! Crisp cotton sheets and very comfortable beds too.There is a lift - but our bags very carried to our room by one of the excellent, helpful English speaking reception staff. Breakfast was a real bonus - I have never eaten so well in a budget price hotel! Eggs, cold meat and cheese and array of bread and pastries that you actually see in bakeries! Yoghurt and tinned fruit too. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel on the last day of our trip, in a locked luggage storage room - for no cost! Before I booked, I couldn't decide to book this hotel or one of the ones in the road at the front of Termini - which are dearer than this one - and having stayed in one before, rather crummy. I am so glad I booked this - it was excellent - I would and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonLuH
Reviews.Content: Lovley hotel in a peaceful settling after all the noise of the city centre. Ok / Good restaurant round the corner, the pizzas and homemade burgers are amazing. Lovely restaurnat as come out of one of the tube exits. 4 min walk to tube stop Cornelia, which is a 10 min ride to Termini, very convienient. Staff brilliant, very helpful, room in great condition, great bathroom, could be noise if had the wrong neighbours. Breafast great. Woudl definatly recommend fo rthe price

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at ALL costs”
Reviews.Author: ArnonCameron
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had been looking forward for many years to seeing Rome. We had heard so much about the various sites. The Colluseum, the Vatican Museum and the Trevi Fountain. When my wife informed me she had booked a surprise break for us I was over the moon and counldn't wait to see the sights. Our first experience of Rome was a taxi ride from the airport to our hotel which cost 55 Euros :-( That aside on entering the Hotel Waldorf we were met at reception by what could best be described as an indifferent receptionist. I put it down to being tired after my journey and thought tomorrow is another day we are in Rome afterall! My optimism proved ill founded. The room was dark and dreary and any thoughts of romance were quickly extinguished. We needed some drinking water in the room and when I went to the Hotel Bar I was greeted by the most arrogant young man you could imagine. After he embarrassed me, he 'sent' me with a ticket to reception which I then had to get stamped and return to him before I got my bottle of water :( After my first night in bed I had bites on my legs from dear only knows what! There was not enough hot water to shave and merely a trickle of hot water out of the shower ... totally inadequate. The breakfast at least was consistent with our experience thus far and they served tined fruit, can you imagine in a country which exports some of the most delicious fresh fruit in the world. The cheese and 'ham' if that is what it was, was almost inedible. Coffee undrinkable and tasted of water which had been passed through something unspeakable. Once we left the Hotel however we were happy. Only my wife had to pay up front for it we would not have stayed one night there. Don't spoil a trip of a lifetime by staying at the Waldorf, I can tell you now you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ann075
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to be disappointed don't stay at this hotel.The hotel itself is situated on the outskirts of Rome although near a metro station.It is in need of refurbishment and current colour schemes are dark and depressing.Our room was navy blue and the shower in the morning was barely a trickle and not hot. The buffet breakfast served tinned fruit plus hams and cheese etc,the coffee was undrinkable. This hotel needs to come into the 21st century and provide customers with the type of service and accomodation they have paid for.Rome itself is a beautiful city,don't spoil it by staying in this hotel. Ann Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Unclean, unhelpful...and did I mention the bed bugs?”
Reviews.Author: truedat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 long nights in early Sept. After taking a quick dislike to the unhelpful staff, whom were more happy to share attitude than assistance, we were horrified to spend the first night in a bed-bug infested room - (which crept into our luggage and now live in our house!) . The head manager changed our room only after a significant battle...standing in the lobby loudly saying things like "FULL OF BED BUGS" did he agree to move us. Too little too late, but worst of all, they put a new family in the room with the bed bugs! perhaps he just wanted to give them some fresh blood. Other than that, the drinks are expensive, the breakfast poor and the hotel area shabby. Do yourself a favour, stay somewhere else and tell your friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is exactly what you'd expect for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ava25
Reviews.Content: Ignoring people's advice about going to Rome in August, I booked the hotel and flight for 5 nights. Hotel was comfortable, staff really helpful- providing maps, info on tours etc, breakfast was your typical European city break breakfast (bit repetitive but still fine). Only thing was the size of the room- was a bit small. I'm sure if I asked they would have changed rooms but it was fine for me and a friend. Air con leaked but again it was sorted out simply by asking staff. In terms of location, it is very close to the Vatican city by metro. Metro is close to the hotel too but a bit more than the advertised 200m!! Area where the hotel is was fine, no probs about people (although one or two cafes around the main road were a bit dodgy!!) Fantastic restaurant at the end of the road where hotel is called Frankies something, which is open late. Um, not much else really except that from Campo di Fiori which is central rome, cabs to hotel are on 15 for 2 people. Would def recomend hotel if your not fussy about little things!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: george069
Reviews.Content: Value for money hotel very close to the metro station, only 5min walk away. Nice breakfast and clean rooms. Excellent choise if you don't want to spend much for your accomodation. I recomend it without doupt.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jally44
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my girlfriend in June and had a brilliant time! We found the hotel Waldorf ideal for our demands. It is a 15 minute metro journey from the city centre (termini stn) which is actually very good as in a nice quite neighbourhood. It is just a 3 minute walk from Cornelia Station. The rooms were clean & comfortable, though the bathroom was very small. Very comfy beds, though they did give us twin room when double requested. Hotel staff could do with some customer service training as throughout stay we didn't witness a smile! Nice breakfast served every morning!! We found an excellent restaurant on route to the station could Lo Zo Frankie which offers lovely food & beer and really good prices compared to the centre. ( Ideal to have few drinks before heading out!) We recommend that you purchase travel card on metro for 4 euros which can be useduntil midnight on metro/bus/tram. Would absolutley recommend the Waldorf for great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Not a three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manoavalley
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Hotel has so many issues that it should be rated a 1-2 star hotel. We were in a room that no one should have been in and we asked to move to another room. They accommodated our request after the first night. The hotel can be described as “The Good, Bad, and Ugly Hotel.” Good: Modest and clean lobby and good first impression. Managers on duty always were able to accommodate our requests. Overall staff seemed friendly and helpful. Our second room in another building was better with marble tiled bathrooms, seemingly newer carpets. Air conditioned Breakfast buffet had good variety of food although the selection was of mediocre food quality. Bad: Mold in the shower stall, window frame and ceiling Molding around the door frame was stripped away (must have been in renovation but bad first impression) Exposed electrical wires on the ceiling in the hallway. No hot water from the sink faucet. If you want a hot shave, do it in the shower. Managers were not friendly…no smiles…almost seemed to discourage questions from guests Two twin beds put together was their double bed. No Kleenex tissue, coffee, and hangers in the closet. No laundry service although they had a schedule of fees for laundry, when we asked the front desk, they said there was no laundry service. Dinners were generally poor. Housekeeping doesn’t vacuum often. We had rubbish sit on the floor for 4 days before we picked it up ourselves. Housekeeping changed sheets after 4 nights (on the fifth night). Ugly Don’t drop anything in the shower because it is so small you won’t be able to pick it up. Rusty sink and shower fixtures, circa 1970 Our second room had a one third swinging glass door for the shower. It looked cool but not very efficient as we couldn’t keep the water from splashing on the floor. Not much of a view unless you like looking at neighboring apartments. Graffiti infested neighborhood with garbage filled trash bins on the street walking to the Metro. I can see why some felt “unsafe” while walking in the area at night. The “short” walk to the Metro became longer each day. This hotel is far from the tourist sights and good restaurants in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaKeith
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about staying here after reading other reviews regarding the location of the hotel, many commented that it was too far out, however I am pleased that I ingnored the warnings. The metro is approx 4-500 meters away from the hotel, and 8 stops which took less than 15 mins to reach the central termini station, the underground runs very regular, infact the longest that we had to wait was less than 5 mins. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable, the breakfast was good but got quite repetative, however I would recommend this hotel as good value for money. It is in a very quiet area and we felt very safe in this area even at night, unlike around the Termini which at night there was many drunks and shady looking people.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Stumball
Reviews.Content: Hi, myself and my wife, daughter and her partner had a delightful weekend in Rome at the Waldorf, we found the hotel clean, tidy and the staff very friendly, the American breakfast bread rolls, ham, cheese and various pastries was a good start to the toils of walking around Rome, a few downsides was a bit of a con at the airport on arrival when you get asked about the taxis to the Hotel, we paid 85 euros which in hindsight was a bit expensive but a Mercedes People mover was very comfortable but the taxi drivers did not look to impressed when we walked past them, I think they would have been cheaper, one Restaurant we visited The Trevi Restaurant was also in our opinion a con, the food was average to say the least and 20 euros for house wine and 10 euros for a bottle of water which you don't realise until you receive the bill as no wine list is supplied. Avoid. Would recommend the Open Top Bus ride, superb value, 18 euros each well spent. The Metro is a great way to get about, we only spent 1 euro to get into Rome and one euro to get back, so frequent and quick. As I say a brilliant weekend, would recommend the hotel and Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: sel00187
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Waldorf in Rome for 8 days and booked through lastminute.com We found the hotel easy to find, but did get off at the wrong metro stop but the hotel is only literally just around the corner from the metro station so it's fantastic in terms of location. When we arrived we were given a basic room, which was nice and thought it was great as we only had a cheap internet deal and for 8 days thought the price was fantastic. However, we woke up the following morning to find insects in the bath, cockroaches on the floor and by the curtains. (As it was a ground floor room and the windows opened straight onto the pavement.) My partner complained and we was moved straight away and they couldnt have done more for us. We were moved, and upgraded to a lovely room with a balcony, which was lovely. The room was very spacious and was cleaned every day without fail. It is quite noisy around the hotel but thats to be expected in a city. Breakfast in the morning was continental, it was very nice. although I did miss my bacon but we both grew a bit tired of eating the same foods every morning after 8 days. At the top of the road there is a bus station so if the metro isnt for you there are plenty of busses about and we had no trouble getting on them or finding out where they went. In 8 days we managed to see everything we wanted to in Rome and always had a nice clean room to return to after a long day sightseeing. At night, we usually ate at the resturant at the top of the road 'Lo Zio Frankie' I think it was called. They were very friendly and the food was gorgeous. It was set outside with lights and trellace around the resturant so it was a lovely setting with the sun going down. It was reasonably priced and if we went back to Rome, we'd love to go back there. We were given free shots and cherries after our meal which was very nice. The staff at the hotel were friendly - each morning we told them where we wanted to get to and they showed us on a map the best way to go - everything is in walking distance in Rome. It was a lovely holiday and we both enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it.”
Reviews.Author: nicky1810
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from Rome. Stayed at the Waldorf at room 335 from 27th Dec 07 to Jan 1st 08 with my girlfriend. We were really happy with the hotel; it is very comfortable, clean and friendly: we recommend it quite highly. Breakfast is a delight. It is situated 5 minutes from " Cornelia Substation" on the Battistini Red line on the metro; which is very cheap and efficient and pretty safe to be honest. The metro is so easy to use, and we found the italians very friendly: there is a fantastic little restaurant right on the exit at Cornelia where we ate most nights. Be careful with the taxi's: we got ripped off big time: but they are not all guilty. Go on a night time tour of Rome: the whole city is fabulous, with far too much to take in; it's overwhelming. Go early to the Vatican and the colloseum: the queus are simply massive: go on a tour: you will be so glad you did and get a hot chocolate by the trevi fountain: It's heavenly! I can recommend everything about Rome and the Waldorf is good to come back and relax in, after the busyness of downtown rome. Its all very good news. John Thompson-Campbell:Astrology Writer from Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, UK.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location, nasty decor and staff with bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: jordinas
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to find that some of the reviews for this hotel give it an Excellent rating. The only thing which I can imagine is that they stayed in one of the renovated rooms which look really nice on the website - but the reality is that they only have a small limited number of these rooms. As you will see from the pictures I will post along with the review the room bears no resemblance to the pictures available online. I'll start with the good as this is a short list: * The bed is reasonably comfortable. The few hours which I managed to sleep, I slept quite well. * Air-conditioning in every room - Probably a must in Rome as it was 28 degrees (about 82 fahrenheit) at the beginning of October so I could not imagine how horrible it would be in the middle of summer if air-conditionining was not available. * Breakfast - The food was reasonable and included in the price of the overnight stay. The juices were plain dreadful, and the coffee was not good - it dispelled the myth that you cannot get a bad coffee in Italy. * Language - Most of the staff spoke reasonably good English (which I would expect from hotel reception staff) which made it quite easy to communicate. The bad: * Location - The hotel is in a not particularly nice area of Rome. Lot of garbage on the streets, overflowing dumpsters and what did not feel like a very safe area. The hotel encourages the use of the air-conditioning in order to keep the windows closed to prevent burglary (not kidding they had a sign in each room stating that!) Getting anywhere near the sites takes a 5 minute walk (brisk) to the Metro station and then about a 20 minute Metro ride. Not particularly central. * Water pressure - The room I stayed in was on the 3rd floor. The water pressure was so weak that it was not even pushing water through all the holes in the shower head - I have included a picture of the shower head pointing to the ceiling with full pressure and it only sprayed about 2 to 3 inches above the shower head. The morning after the first night I went down to complain and they told me that a large group had checked out and that it affected the pressure. The second morning I went down and asked if they had a large group checking out that morning and with a puzzled look they told me no, so I asked what the reason for the lack of water pressure was this morning on the 3rd floor... to which he answered "Oh let me change your room." * Noise - The walls are paper thin. The hotel adjoins an apartment building, and my room was next to an apartment where at 4am I got woken up by coughing and then a barrage of cabinets and drawers being opened and slammed closed. Then at about 5 someone either in the room next to mine or above mine got up and took a shower - all of which I could hear loud and clear. * Attitude of staff - Unfortunately for some of the staff, I speak Spanish, which is close enough to Italian for me to reasonably understand a conversation. The main language I spoke was English and the general attitude and comments to some of their colleagues about me were quite surprising. Imagine their shock when in my broken Italian I told them that I speak Spanish and understand Italian quite well. * Elevator - The carpet in the elevator was nasty and there was frequently quite pungent smells in there. On the plus side, it was so nasty that I opted to use the stairs more often than the elevator - which is better for my health. * Mold around the window and in some of the tile grout - The bathroom was reasonably modern, but there was quite a bit of mold around the window and in some of the tile grout - so if I was alergic I may have had some serious problems. * Room Key - I went up to my room and the key would not open the door. It was quite frustrating. I went back to the front desk and the person behind the desk was quite condescending. He walked with me to the elevator and pointed and told me my room was on the 3rd floor and I should be able to find it! I repeated that I knew where the room was but the key did not work, so he begrudgingly came up to the room with me. I handed him the key and it did not work for him either. After several italian curse words and a significant amount of jostling the key, he was able to finally open it. It was quite a frustrating process each time I had to go back to my room. * "Wi-Fi available" - Despite the sign on the front desk reception proclaiming that Wi-Fi is available in the hotel, good luck finding a Wi-Fi signal! * No light switch near the bed and no night stand (although there is no room for it) - Fortunately there was a remote control for the TV, so I could turn on the TV turn off the light, and get into bed with the light from the TV and then turn off the TV not ideal, and it is the first time that I have ever stayed in a hotel where this was the case. The ugly: * The entire decor is quite gaudy. The lobby does not look horrible, but as soon as you go up to the floors where the rooms are it is dark, dirty and musty. * The room decor makes the place look like a funeral home. The colors are really dark and in a style which would be right at home sometime in the late 1800's. The walls are covered with material and padding - so I can honestly say I stayed in a padded room. The entire experience was just plain dreadful, and I would strongly discourage anyone considering this hotel from staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: NDRT
Reviews.Content: Me and my Nan stayed at the Hotel Waldorf from Wednesday 12th September until 15th September. We travelled to Rome Ciapino by Ryanair, would definatly fly with them again, it was excellent value for money and the flight was smooth. We took a terravision bus from the airport to the Termini station which is about 45 minutes from the airport. From Termini we too the metro line A to Cornelia which took about 20minutes. We brought a Carta integrata Settimanale ticket which was excellent value for money which we could use on all forms of transport in Rome to reach the main attractions. The metro is a very pleasent experience compared to London. Most of the trains have air conditioning which meant in the 32 degree heat we were all nice and cool. At arrival to Cornelia station it was a 5 minute walk to the hotel, it was very hard locating the hotel, I had to ask a few of the locals for directions, but once you are able to find your way there once, you will have no problems finding it again. The hotel itself is very nice although it is in a very strange location in a quiet residential street which is along distance from the main attractions of Rome. I would not want to stay at the hotel on my own and would not have felt very safe walking in the night on my own to and from the hotel. The B and H hotels have other chains of hotel much closer to the centre of Rome which might be more ideal for children and famililies. This hotel is ok if the are on a package holiday with a tour company with a coach which picks you up from the hotel takes you sight seeing and then brings you back to the hotel. You can reach the main attractions from the hotel by the wide variety of different transport systems in Rome which come very frequently, you need to have your ticket before you go onto the bus, train etc. If you do not mind having to travel into the main centre and out again which is very tiring after sightseeing all day this hotel is for you otherwise think about getting a hotel which is more central. Although the hotel is excellent value for money I think the hotel should be cheaper because of where it is located in the middle of no where. I booked a superior room and was surprised to find that the extra trimmings were not in my room but I spoke to the manager and quickly a porter brought all the necessary things to my room. The Rome was fine for the two of us and anyway we did not need anything luxary as we spent a very limited time in our room. Although it could have had a larger window in the room as our room only had a small balcony door to let light through so it was very dark in our room and we needed to turn the lights on even in the day time. The hotel is very large I think I prefer the smaller hotels. You have to provide a 30 euro deposit to have the air conditioning controller and ask for your mini fridge to be opened on arrival. The breakfast at the hotel is out of this world experience, wide range of different products on offer, everything you ever wanted to get you through the day until dinner is provided different cheeses, meats, breads, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, jam, chocolate spread, honey, pastry, cakes, tea, coffee, hot. chocolate, water. The hotels restaurant was closed for some reason during our stay their is a few local restaurants near the hotel if you can not face having to travel into the centre of Rome after sightseeing. We went on a hop on and hop of bus which meant we could sit back and relax and take in all the scenary.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: LondonNanny
Reviews.Content: Myself, my daughter and 7 year old grandson stayed at the hotel between the 22nd and 29th August, 2007. We had a triple room and it was to what we would consider a high standard for the price. It was clean, air conditioned and had en suite facilities. Our balcony overlooked the 'Secret Garden' and was well situated on the 1st Floor. The staff were excellent. Everyone from the front of house staff to the porters and maid service were cheerful and unhesitatingly helpful. The continental breakfast was excellent and we looked forward to it, it set us up for the day. When we came back exhausted in the evenings the 'Secret Garden' was a haven where we could relax with a drink, play cards and chat. On our last night (we had to get to bed early because we had early flights),we even enjoyed a takeaway meal in the 'Secret Garden' with our wine from the bar! On 'Tour' days when we had a very early start the staff arranged for a packed breakfast for us. The hotel was close to the Metro 'A' Line which was very easy to use and we were able to get to all the major sites in Rome on the 'A' Line or on 'B' Line via Terminii Station. (Users of the London Underground do not be put off - the Metro is a quite different experience). But be aware it closes at 9.00 p.m. every day. All in all, we had a very enjoyable stay in a lovely hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jason7708
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for two people and paid £42 a night. We had a room with tv,balcony, air conditioning all night and a hot powerful shower in the well kept bathroom. Breakfast is buffet continental style so eat as much as you like. Staff were polite and helpful too. The room was kept very well by the staff with more fresh towels per day than we could use. One tiny negative was no duvet, just a sheet and cover which may not bother some people but I did miss my duvet. If you have trouble finding it as alot of people have written, simply print off a map from the net, we found it this way without a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Use reviews to manage your expectations...& then lower them”
Reviews.Author: OrangeGirl17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Waldorf July 27-29, 2007: Rooms: 1. Small, but ok. Two twin beds pushed together to make a "double" 2. Small balcony 3. Small bathroom but clean Location: 1. 5 minutes from the Cornelia stop is about right. Was easiest to get a 3 day pass on the Metro and went to all the stops we wanted to see. 2. Lot of graffitti in the area... we weren't bothered but be wary. Weird things: 1. Before this stay I've never before had to pay a deposit for my remote to work the air conditioning (for a room I've already paid for in advance!). Maybe I look like a college kid (am a 30-something) - but the front desk man said something about people stealing the air conditioners or the remotes. Yeah... right. The ceiling is at least 10 feet and I'm 5 ft tall... Of course, he made no mention of the A/C deposit when we first checked in - we went to our room and it was hot. So I had to go back downstairs...and argh... let's just say that this front desk man couldn't be bothered or didn't believe customer service is a redeeming value. He wanted 30 euro cash for the deposit - but I only had 20 pounds coming from England. (I did get my deposit back in full.) To insure I got it back I locked the remote in my luggage during the day. 2. Internet access: Get a card w/ a code as soon as you can and keep it. This is the dumbest business decision I have ever encountered. I'm sure they have their "reasons" but customer satisfaction is last on the list. In order to use the computers for the Internet - you got a card with a code. It was 3 euros/hr and you could refill or top up the card. DON'T give it back until you know you are done w/ the Internet. They only have a certain number of cards and if they are out...no internet for you even if there's no one at the computers. To add on to that - the cards are tied to a specific computer. We went down 3 different times with no luck. And one lady had to wait for someone else to finish with the computer he was on - despite the fact the other was available because the cards were tied to a specific computer. There are some internet cafes nearby - but running old versions of windows that don't pull up the graphics on web sites. Very frustrating. 3. Breakfast - was average at best and nothing to write home about by any means. A mediocre buffet - I've had better buffets and friendly service at the Hampton Inn in the US. All in all - it might be worth it to spend a little more and get something a little nicer. But it's better than a hostel. There was a specific staff member I grew to despise and will not go back for that reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Miroro
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hote, and I booked it this second time based on my previous experience. This hotel is modern and in a quiet street in the north part of Rome. The nearest subway station is cca 300 meters away. It is about 2-3 subway stops from the Vatican. And it is on the subway line that goes through the Termini main train station. Rooms in this hotel were always clean and well kept. Furniture is modern as well and bathrooms are nice as well. I can't complain about the rooms at all. From what I saw, some of the rooms of the hotel are on street level and they do not have a nice view. But they are clean. All rooms have the same standard So, ask for rooms on higher floor, if I may suggest you. But it is a good mid-range hotel. I will not mond staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: xnme
Reviews.Content: tries to look flash but there are a lot of technical problems with the hotel. flooding in the bathrooms is the main problem. rooms are small with not enough room for more than one suitcase - a shame if you're a couple. staff are rude. wide variety of things for breakfast but quality is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent”
Reviews.Author: woosbunny
Reviews.Content: If you just want a room to lay your head-then its ok! Room was small-no kettle for that morning coffee and watch the plumbing, we were flooded out when we emptied the bath, the water came up through the floor tiles! When we reported it, they fixed the problem by removing the plug!! Reprots from other residents about problems with the plumbing as well. Staff were polite and helpful, but beware of the bar staff and charges for drinks-one night, two drinks were 10 euros the next night, same drinks-20 euros. The restaurant is only available for group bookings in advance, but the breakfast is adequete. Rooms are cleaned to a high standard. The hotel is within easy reach of the metro.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: bjcCardiff
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend didnt know what to expect due to mixed reviews however we were pleasantly surprised. Considering teh price we paid, the room although small was comfortable, a god powe shower and the breakfast was impressive! It is only 1 euro on the metro & takes about 20mins from the main station. We found this was good as we were too busy during the day to go back anyway! The only advice i would give is the A line which is the underground you need to catch finished at 9.30pm and the buses are longer and more complicated. all in all good value for money and we'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in beautiful Roma”
Reviews.Author: ABPat
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with knowledgeable and friendly staff. Room was a very good size and very clean and tidy. Transport into the city center is very easy with a metro station and buses in less than 10 minutes walk away and there is also a very nice outdoor garden area to have a few drinks in after a big day sightseeing. Only complaint we had was the 3 course meal that was advertised in the hotel, this was unfortunately very very basic and not alot of food for an evening meal, they also ran out of some of the food by the time deserts came along. We think it was a tourist bus meal put on and the hotel were trying to make a little extra money from it. It was very obvious that it was not a normal restaurant was was set up for breakfasts only. Overall though a really good quality hotel and would recommend everything there apart from the meal at night.

Reviews.Title: “Roma Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Honeymeow
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a 17 minute journey on the Metro from Termini Station & then a 5 minute walk from there. The hotel on first impressions was very clean and pleasant looking. The room we were allocated was a bit on the small side but still perfectly reasonable for the price we paid. We had a T.V, balcony although there weren't any tea or coffee making facilities, it was clean and the bathroom was adequate. We went for dinner in the restaurant on our first night which wasn't enjoyable as it was too bright (yellow decor) it could have benefited from them turning out the lights and lighting a few candles and low wattage lamps to create a more relaxing atmosphere, also it was very warm which began to be uncomfortable after a while, it actually got so bad that it began to make us feel queasy. The food left a lot to be desired, they only offered a set menu which consisted of four courses, first was meats & cheese, next was a bland tasting attempt at lasagne, followed by a pork chop, fried chips & a weird looking artichoke flower which was soggy and not very tasty ( i did try it before concluding it was disgusting) our dessert was a springy blamange. We went for breakfast once out of the 3 days we were there and that wasn't any better than the dinner. The bar within the hotel was very reasonably priced. On our 2nd night we went to the restaurant around the corner which was delicious and good value for money, on our last night we ventured further a field and found a local trattoria down a side street, it was lovely, the whole menu was in Italian so it took a bit of guess work but at least we knew it was genuine Italian family cuisine, again good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Really smart and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: londonxray
Reviews.Content: Just a 5 minute walk from Cornelia Metro station, but when you arrive go with a good map, the road layout is rather confusing. The hotel has been recently redecorated and is very smart throughout. On arrival I was given the old Italian Hotel burst water pipe story so was moved to another hotel for the 1st night; same facilities but the other hotel was rather shabby. I didn't mind though as it was late and only went there to sleep, also I liked the receptionist. I spent the next 6 nights at the Waldorf, staff were always very helpful, a big choice of breakfast, room had a balcony. Room was very smart and clean. A very enjoyable stay. When you go check in earlier in the evening to avoid those troublesome Italian burst water pipes.

Reviews.Title: “New and Rennoveted”
Reviews.Author: blad
Reviews.Content: The room allocated was very big and quite .the breakfast was buffet Amerian very excellent! the stuff helpfull and they have a very comfort terrace solarium and secret garden. the entry is free!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews made out”
Reviews.Author: bugalu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was much better than I thought. Remnisient of a Holiday Inn but better. Recently refurbished and immaculate. Breakfast was plentiful (no cooked breakfast for the stalwart but hey we are in Rome!). The Receptionist and the English lady behind the bar were very helpful. You get a huge glass of nice red wine for 4 euro so I was well away!! Downside is that this hotel is not within walking distance of the centre of Rome. However, the bus terminal and Metro is 5 minutes walk and very easy to use. I favoured the Metro. A day travel card was 4 euro. You can even get a train from platform 24 Termini into Leonardo airport for 11 euro. Be warned that Line A of the Metro shuts at 9pm. Several stops on the Metro from Cornelia (hotel 5 min walk) will see you in the centre of Rome. Every attraction is walkable - be sure to pick up a free map from reception. Taxi's rip you off - beware the man with a voice synthesiser who is an illegal cabbie and charges you 95 euro to take you to the hotel. What a scumbag! Get in a metered cab but use the Metro as it's so much cheaper. The area local to the hotel is not especially great. There is a nice local used restaurant 5 mins walk, opposite the bus station. I think it is called Luis's or something similar. It does pizza's from 5 euro and several courses and a couple of drinks cost only 20 euro. Whats more is that it's actually nice! Rome is a great city. The Vatican is a must. Try to find a tour to help you jump the queue. The Pantheon and Trevi fountain are also impressive. Every turn in the road seems to house a fascinating insite into this wonderful city steeped in history.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: TravelersHsv
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Rome with our 3 children, ages 9, 12 and 14. The staff was great at the Hotel Waldorf. They were very helpful at all hours, even when we had to check out at 4:30 A.M. to make a 7:00 flight home. We had two rooms, a double and a triple. The rooms were clean and nice, although small by American standards, but we didn't care. We spent most of our time sightseeing anyway. The breakfast was great, with an enormous number of choices. Although it is not in the center of Rome, it worked well for us since we spent all our time out sightseeing until the evening. Actually, it was nice being in a real Roman nieghborhood, and we enjoyed meeting some of the people who were not in a "tourist area". The Waldorf is close to the Cornelia (line A) metro station, and also a nice cafeteria and restaurant that are both full of friendly local people.
