We had already arranged a tour to Florence and Naples/Pompeii, but they can help you with that too, if you don't already have plans. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf, Sweet but Far”
Reviews.Author: lozana36
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf was wonderful. Simply put, the place was clean, the staff was awesome, not to mention the extremely good looking gentleman who gave us an enthusiastic Ciao! on our way out. The bathroom was lovely and CLEAN. The complimentary breakfast that came with the stay was one of the best I've ever had. I mean, they did not want for anything. Eggs, breads, fruits, an array of foods and drinks...etc. Everything was awesome except its distance from the heart of Rome. The bus depot is around the corner, however it is a little tiresome after a day roaming Rome. All in all, I'd stay there again but be sure to book through expedia or any other agency/site NOT through the hotel because the rate for us was $58/night whereas it was 60Euro for others...it can get pricey.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lisajane
Reviews.Content: All in all a very pleasant small hotel in a good location. The hotel is right next to a metro station meaning that you always have a good starting point for sightseeing. We ate locally in the evenings and the food was exceptional and we paid very reasonable prices. It was good to get out of the hustle and bustle of central Roma after a full days sightseeing to relax in a busy but hassle free town. The room we had was fine with twin beds and a clean bathroom. It smelt of bad drains went we first went in but the smell soon went. After reading the reviews i was expecting a hotel from hell but it was far from that. The breakfast was good and all the staff friendly. It was a bargain break and my expectations were reasonably low but its nice when you get a pleasant suprise. I loved Roma and had a fabulous pre xmas break but the beggars and buskers and hawkers drive you mad. I wont go back to Roma for this reason. I must have been asked for money or to buy some piece of junk at least once every ten minutes.... and the state of the children....hawked around for money and always asleep. Are they drugged? Anyway, no beggars near the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: RoydonTraveller
Reviews.Content: Before leaving I read all the reviews, good and bad and what can I say but yes they are all true but we had the most fantastic time! We were firstly put in a room which was obviously a single room but with a double bed... but it was fun! We got moved the next day to a bigger and better room but to be honest, I preffered the very cosy little room. The hotel is 2 stops away from the Vatican on metro line A and is without doubt a good location for a hotel as it got you out of the expensive tourist area into the suberbs mingling with locals. We went each night (4) to the same ristorante which was just over the road....LA SEADAS. Such fantastic food, great fun and very good prices. We were treated as part of a large family with free food and wine all night long. From 7.30 to 11pm we didnt stop eating or drinking and the bill was a miniscule 35 euros for the 2 of us. Bottom line, if you want a great cheap weekend in Rome and have a sense of humour then this place is just great. I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “The most bizarre hotel I have stayed in this year”
Reviews.Author: ianjmorley
Reviews.Content: This ranks as the most bizarre hotel of the year for me. Their website proudly states that the hotel has been refurbished. This is not correct. SOME of the hotel has, but many rooms haven't. I had the pleasure of staying in both a refurbished and un-refurbished room. The unrefurbished room had: * No shower door (lots of water on the floor) * Mould growing all over the bathoroom walls * One broken chair * 1 bedside lamp (unplugged) * Appalling TV reception Some positives also: * A balcony overlooking a quiet road I was pleased when I was asked to move into a refurbished room. This was ok except for: * Being located overlooking a very noisy road * Bedding that did not fit the bed * No fan in the bathroom * Water leaks causing the paper to come off the ceiling * A radiator that did not work. Don't use the shower between 8&9 am - you get a dribble only. Breakfast was intriguing: * Awful coffee from a machine * Tinned peaches and other fruit * Scrambled egg kept in an unheated container (yuck) We had good fun - felt a bit like staying at Fawlty Towers - but I wouldn't rush to stay there again..... The good news is that they are now starting to re-furbish the others rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jock-Holiday
Reviews.Content: Found this to be a great little hotel outside of the main centre of Rome, but within easy reach of all the attractions by metro [5 minute walk away from the hotel] or by bus [also 5 minute walk from the hotel]. We used the number 46 bus which only took about 20 minutes to reach the Colosseum and also passed the Vatican and other tourist attractions and was much quicker then other bus routes. On arrival at the hotel we were given a tiny room, the words "swing a cat" came to mind! It did have a large balcony and large bathroom and was very clean but it only a 4 foot bed and no room to move or unpack a case. We asked to be moved to a larger room with a "proper" size bed and were told that all rooms were full but we would be moved the next day. Sure enough, the next day we were moved to a much larger room although it didn't have a balcony but plenty of room to swing a cat! Breakfast was buffet style with plenty of variety and loads of food which was constantly topped up. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean and tidy, rooms cleaned daily, beds comfortable and once we had changed rooms the bed was huge! I would certainly return to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone who wants a hotel outside of the city centre, but if you don't want to use buses or metro then get a hotel nearer the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money....”
Reviews.Author: Arielarafe
Reviews.Content: We just returned back to Rome after 2 weeks vacation in parts of Italy to catch a return flight back home and was hoping it will be easy to book a room online while in Italy at the very last minute to get a good deal. We didn't realize most decent 2-3 star hotel needs a 48 hour prior notice. So, at last we tried a website which serves as a last resort for the last minute hotel booking and got a room in this hotel for a discount (orig 210 Euros and we got it for 120 Euros). This hotel list as a 3 star but it's 1 star to us and I've stayed at better 1 star hotel (I travelled a lot for business and I've stayed from 6 stars to 1 star hotels) and the pictures are deceiving. They have given us a very clear direction from the train station but nothing after that. We then spend half an hour searching for the hotel even though it's five minutes walk from the train station as it's really hidden in a suburban neighborhood. Since there is no door to the entrance of the hotel when we were there, bugs were flying in from the outside and while we were using the internet which is next to the front entrance, we got bug bites all over our legs and arms just sitting there...and we realized they haven't clean the carpet for a VERY LONG time which is one of the reason that attracted the bugs. Our room was okay (it's small but all rooms are small in Europe) but our bathroom was not clean. The crevice between the tiles were black...and there is no curtain in the shower so the water were flying out of the shower...also, reception is not helpful either because we tried to ask them to dial a local number for us to confirm a pick up for the airport and they just simply told us to do it ourselves...last but not the least - they had listed that they are minutes away to everything but it's really 30 minutes because you HAVE to take a train ride to all the major attraction in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: chickenmonkeybear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a brilliant hotel for its location. At first glance it appears to be too far outside of the centre of Rome and I was nervous about this at first but it was perfectly situated. About a 3 min walk from the metro in a predominantly residential area with a few shops and places to eat. The area seems as decent as any other city area I've been to and gives you an insight into the normal way of live, not just the tourist attractions. The metro costs 1 euro regardless of where you are going and takes about 5 mins to get to the Vatican and about 12 mins to get to the Termini. When we arrived At Ciampino airport we got a Terravision bus to the Termini which cost 8 euro each and then a taxi from the Termini to the hotel cost us around 20 euros (make sure you have a good map that shows where the hotel is with you and the name of the street written down as the taxi drivers couldn't understand our terrible pronunciation and so we resorted to showing them on the map.) It was after midnight when we were at the Termini, we had no problems and were even greeted by a random official tourist information officer with a badge who seemed to be randomly wandering round the area looking after the tourists and generally making them feel safe. The room was tastefully plainly decorated and was perfectly clean. The guests arriving back late at night in adjoining rooms seemed a little noisy but i think the walls were just thin, we turned the airconditioning on and that was enough to drown them out. The bathroom had a hairdryer and a very well lit, large mirror it was lovely and clean with both a short bath and a shower. Breakfast was a good buffet with plenty of choice, I didnt feel like I was going to get food poisoning as food was regularly refreshed, the dining room was plesant and the tables cleared and relaid quickly, there was plenty of seating so no need to fight over tables. We found the staff polite and friendly. This hotel in my opinion is of a better standard than a 3 star hotel in England and is ideal for travellers and couples on a budget who don't want to 'slum it'. One thing about Rome... There is more graffitti than in London, don't let it make you feel intimidated as it doesn't seem to indicate a 'rough' area it is just everywhere! Don't let the negative reviews put you off this hotel as it really is a little gem for a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Freeway5
Reviews.Content: The walls here are not paper thin.They are paper. I kid you not!!!! It also far from the city centre although near the metro. Unfortunately that shuts at 8pm due to ongoing work. If you are getting a taxi from City centre make sure it is metered. From P.d. Popolo it should cost approx15-18 euros. Be very wary of offered taxis anywhere and particularly at the main train station (where the airport buses drop you). It is hard to find being down a side street and the area isn't the greatest at night. Didn't feel threatened ( I am from glasgow!), just a bit wary. If you want a chap base to explore Rome it is OK. Just a bit noisy and far out. Breakfast is fine, staff friendly enough and I found it clean. In all honesty though the money you save by staying here you will lose on taxi/metro fares.

Reviews.Title: “The cockraches are bigger than the room !!”
Reviews.Author: adriennne
Reviews.Content: Forget this hotel. Flew with Ryanair. Big mistake ! Arrived at midnight from UK. Taxi 55 euros .Pleasant staff but as we were the last to arrive were given the last room - a french double !! 10 feet / 8 feet. You can work out the metric size!! The French must be very small as the bed was only 4 feet wide! Lovely big bathroom. Twice the size of the bedroom.. Leave if they book you into room 133 !!! We booked 2 weeks prior so no excuses ! After having the cockroach removed !!! (The bed was too small for him) we were told we would be moved next day when guests moved out. We were and the room was slightly bigger ! We did have a double bed !!! Shame about the bathroom ! Ok if you were a very small Italian !! Bath was so small you had to be double joined to fit in.. But at least you were ok if you only wanted your cheeks washed !! I am not joking !!! The manager was too important to speak to us when we complained but gave a 10% discount. This is a newish hotel who couldn't care less as they are full all the time due to internet bookings ! On the positive side - very clean... oh by the way the water pressure is dodgy. We only had a trickle of water on the last day. Were told it was water company at fault! But if we wanted could be changed to a room with water... Work that one out !! Don't wate your money -- and as the soundproofing is very poor all you can hear are the very noisy and loud Germans !!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time & money”
Reviews.Author: BarryN
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Waldorf in September / 05 as the first stop on our first Euopean trip. Not exactly the way to create a good first impression. We thought that we would like to strike out on our own and see Rome,before we met up with the rest of our group the next day. We looked at some brochures in the lobby and asked the front desk to make arrangements for the next morning. Well, guess what happened the next morning, no tour because the front desk FORGOT to phone and make arrangements. The next morning we were told that breakfast would be at 7 A.M. Unfortunately the kitchen was told 7:30. So we had 15 minutes to eat before we got on our tour bus. It was just like Fawlty Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are two females and stayed at the Waldorf Hotel for four nights. Great breakfast. Staff pleasant and helpful. Found it easy to access from Cornelia Metro and bus (46), but be careful to take correct exit from Metro (Monti De Creito) we got lost after taking wrong one. Very safe.With excellent and reasonable restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Miles out of town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far out of the centre of town. From the main train station (Termini) you have to get the tube to the last stop but one on the A line metro (or pay 50 euros for a taxi). Its about 10 stops on the tube to get to the centre of town and 4 stops to get to the vatican. You are better off getting the bus (48) which takes about 20 mins to get into the centre however the service stops around 24.00 so if you are planning on going out later expect to pay around 40 euros for a taxi back.The rooms are fine however the staff are unhelpful and rude. Breakfast is until 10am and all service stops punctually. Including turning off the coffee and juice machines even if you are still eating. The only good thing about this hotel is the night manager Fernado who is lovely. I would not recommend this hotel unless you can find nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kizwhit
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Waldorf over the New Year period. Our whole experience was excellent in every respect. We agree the rooms are slightly dated, but big enough with extremely comfortable beds. Breakfast was ample and very tasty. It is about 4 metro stops from the Vatican going away from the city centre, but it was only a 5 minute walk to the Cornelia metro stop and a 10/15 minute tube ride into the centre. I have to say the front desk staff, and in particular Fernando, were superb. He was friendly, courteous and professional. I would definitely stay here again or recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, thanks for all the comments below, they are really helpful! Before I booked the hotel I was not sure, but I am quite satisfied with the hotel! Do not worry about the bad comments. Two friends and I arrived in Roma from a night train from Venezia on the second of Jan 2006. The Hotel Waldorf as said by other reviewers is in a residential area quite away from city centre. However these is a metro station and bus hub, very easy to move around. We had a quite big triple room, it is clean. We felt cold in the night and not sure if they turned off the heater?! The bathroom is not as good as the bedroom and functional. Hotel staffs are friendly. Breakfast was also good, they even have iced coffee! Pls try the Zo Frankie near the bus hub, it is really excellent, and the 2 course lunch menu (only 7.5 euros) is wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Supremely helpful staff in useful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located in a very quiet street in a very noisy city. And although the Waldorf is a good way from some of the main attractions, it is very close to the Metro Underground, which gets you close to most places very quickly. It is also close to bus services which get you to most other places though less quickly. It is very quick and easy to get to the Vatican (three stops on the Metro). The front desk staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. The bar is good, but a bit expensive. Breakfast: good selection of food offered for all tastes, though fruit is tinned, not fresh. Coffee, though from a machine, was astonishingly good The rooms, though small, are adequate with reasonable storeage space. They are very clean and the bathrooms, though also small, are fine. Over all, very good value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: B&H Waldorf
HotelInfo.Address: Via Andrea Alciato 14-16, 00167 Rome, Italy
